title: Corner Penthouse in an Industrial-Style Building in Manhattan’s West Chelsea Neighborhood
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: West Chelsea, Manhattan Price: $9.25 million

This corner penthouse in Manhattan’s West Chelsea neighborhood offers a private rooftop terrace and 46 feet of casement windows that overlook the iconic High Line park and flood the apartment with natural light.

Architect Cary Tamarkin is "well known for his mix of cement and interesting casement windows," said listing agent Juliana Frei.

The penthouse sits atop a 10-story, 15-unit building, which "was meant to mimic and be a complement to all of the industrial-style buildings that were once there in West Chelsea," she said.

"It’s a well-heeled building," between Tenth and Eleventh avenues on the south side of West 24th Street, she said.

Mr. Tamarkin’s signature wrap casement windows "allow a tremendous amount of light to flow through the apartment," Ms. Frei said. "It gets both morning and evening light."

More: Interior Designer Shawn Henderson Lists Loft-Like Manhattan Co-Op

Other architectural and design details include a wood-burning fireplace in the living room, 11-foot ceilings, white oak floors, a washer/dryer and central air conditioning. The elevator opens directly into the apartment, and a private storage unit is included with the apartment.

Along with the 1,900-square-foot rooftop terrace, there is a smaller, east-facing terrace off the master bedroom.

The owners bought the apartment as an investment property and have never lived in it, Ms. Frei said. It has consistently rented for about $35,000 a month.

The apartment is "extremely private," she added. "It’s a whole, full floor with a private rooftop—that’s one of its main selling points."

The kitchen holds a full-size dining area and is quite large, Ms. Frei said. "It’s like a kitchen that you would find in a house, outside of Manhattan."

The kitchen features burnished bronze Nanz hardware, marble countertops and backsplash, custom walnut cabinetry and Sub-Zero, Miele and Viking appliances.

More: Matt Cohler Lists Swanky Manhattan Penthouse for $29.5 Million

The master suite has corner windows with north and east exposures, two oversized walk-in closets with custom shelving and storage, and a marble bathroom with a double vanity, soaking tub and a separate stall shower.

The penthouse offers open city views of the High Line, the Hudson River, the Empire State Building and the historic, low-rise section of the Chelsea neighborhood.

Stats

The 3,318-square-foot penthouse has three bedrooms, three full bathrooms and one partial bathroom. There is also a 1,900-square-foot rooftop terrace.

More: Porsche Debuts a More Affordable Taycan—and Plans a Plug-In Plane

Amenities

Amenities include a full-time doorman, a fitness center, private storage, a bike room, a 1,300-square-foot common courtyard and a conference room.

Neighborhood Notes

The building is in the heart of the West Chelsea Gallery District and adjacent to the High Line park. The new Hudson Yards development is just to the north, and the Whitney Museum of American Art and Chelsea Market are to the south.

Agents: Juliana Frei, Brown Harris Stevens, and Justin Park, Scott Parks International Realty
